result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
to Judge Jacobson from Atty. Bachman - request to reset sentencing hearing - approved 2/9/16
includes 14CF304, 14CM660, 14CF921, 15CF793, 15CF927, 15CF930
Copy of PSI forwarded to parties;  DA's Office via email; Attorney Bachman via mail

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:06 am 
INCLUDES 14CF304, 14CF921, 14CM660, 15CF793, 15CF927, AND 15CF930. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty John Bachman. 
COURT notes intent to order PSI in these matters. 
OTR: 10:08 am BOTR: 10:09 am 
Atty Bachman notes def wishes to proceed with plea hearing today. 

WAIVER OF PRELIM IN 15CF793. 
Atty Bachman waives need for preliminary hearing in 15CF793. 
Court questions deft as to waiver.  
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.

PLEA HEARING IN ALL FILES. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 
State files amended information in 14CF304. 
State moves to: 
In 14CF921: Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF927: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF930: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 14CF304: Ct. 1 (4th Degree Sexual Assualt)>>GUILTY. 
                    : Ct. 2 (DC)>>GUILTY. 
In 14CF921: Ct. 1 (Drive or Operate a Vehicle without Consent)>>GUILTY. 
In 14CM660: Ct 1 (Retail Theft)>>GUILTY. 
In 15CF793: Ct. 1 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Store Methamphetamine)>>GUILTY. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: PSI to be completed within 6 weeks of today's date. 
Sentencing Hearing set for February 11, 2016 at 11am in Br. 3. 
Adj: 10:31 am

Served on P.H. 10/19/15 via email
for 10/26/15 Preliminary Hearing

Includes 15CF930 and 15CF927.   No contact with victim(s):  R.M.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.   Absolute sobriety from illicit substances and alcohol.    Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 with day reporting.Includ
